title: Shadow Warrior: Wanton Destruction released
content:
Well, "[url=http://www.3drealms.com/news/2005/09/wanton_destruction_for_shadow.html]Wanton Destruction for Shadow Warrior Released![/url]" it says on 3D Realms' site.
With a little bit of work, it works with JonoF's port as well, as can be read [url=http://jonof.edgenetwork.org/forum/viewtopic.php?t=615]here[/url].
Basically JonoF only needs to add the choice to choose between the 2 GRP files, and it's fully compatible.
For now, it works like the link above says.

Don't forget to move your .map files to a subdirectory or something.
I kept on getting the old levels until suddenly I hit my head and realised those overrid the ones in the .grp.
(I extracted them so I could open them in Build.)Retodon8

title: Re: Shadow Warrior: Wanton Destruction released
content:
I've played a couple of levels now, and I have to say it's a waste they didn't release this.
I suppose maybe it's true that Shadow Warrior wasn't that popular, even Duke Nukem 3D came right before Quake, meaning it couldn't have reached as much people as it could've if Quake was later, but still...
Wanton Destruction was completely finished, they could've just pressed a relatively small amount of CD's for the real fans... they would've bought it.
Oh well... I'm enough of a fan of the game to enjoy it now too.
I've had some nice memories about this game (and Duke as well of course).

See the thread I linked to above; JonoF added how to make a batch file to run both SW vanilla and WD without having to rename the GRP.
I didn't know that was possible, but apparently. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
I also added how to work with different sets of save games, so they don't keep overwriting.
I didn't actually test it (yet), but it should work.Retodon8

title: Re: Shadow Warrior: Wanton Destruction released
content:
No new weapons, and either some, or no new enemies, depending on your definition.
The coolie and coolie ghost remain the same, as does the Ripper (I think), and the hornets are the same.
The gun fodder enemy, the evil ninja has changed graphics and sounds.
The amount of hitpoints, his behaviour, that kind of thing is identical though.
The same story for the green guy whose head you could use as a weapon... forgot the name.
The most important aspect are the new levels, of which I have (seen) no screenshots.Retodon8
